name: Starbase Destroyer
description:
Starbase Destroyer

Explore outer space and destroy enemy starbases. Your target should be base core which is essential part of each starbase and it cannot survive without it.

Trigger chains of explosions of damaged starbase parts.

First 5 levels are an introduction to different game features.

There are 3 different levels of difficulty:

  • asteroids
  • asteroids + monsters
  • asteroids + monsters + rockets

For BONUS points make homing missles or monsters crash on asteroids waves. 

Auto-generated levels

Starbase generator supports 3 different algorithms with different outcome characteristics.

Up to 4 starbases are placed on each level. Some of them are predefined, others are random and unique.

On higher levels more complex starbases are available, built with more parts.

Starbase editor

This version contains Starbase Editor which allows to extend game by designing own starbases which you can destroy later in game.

Starbases created and saved in editor may occur randomly during normal gameplay.

Have fun!

Start with first levels to get to know all game features.

Then decide which difficulty do you prefer.

For bigger challenge select much higher level and draw a level with lower number, but more complex starbases.

You can also generate an interesting and more challenging starbase in starbase editor or design one yourself.

Controls Main game

Use arrows or WSAD keys to move - you can fly vertically, horizontally and diagonally.

Space or Ctrl - Fire (you can hold it for continuous fire)

Escape - Pause or confirm Quit

Main menu

Use arrow keys or mouse to select option.

Confirm with Enter od Space.

Starbase Editor

Left mouse button - build new starbase elements or destroy existing ones

Drag having right mouse button pressed - move viewport

Mouse scroll - zoom in and out in certain range

Buttons
  1. Clear - destroy whole project and start from scratch
  2. Load - load existing project to modify it
  3. Save - save project for later changes or to have a change of seeing your project in normal game!
  4. Center - center viewport on main starbase core
  5. Reflection - build up to two parts at once, using reflection around starbase center
  6. Parts - input how many parts should have starbase after generation
  7. Algorithm - select single algorithm to use in generator
  8. Generate - generate starbase having selected number of parts and using preferred generation algorithm
  9. Play - play the challenge against single starbase with just created design
